clinical_study.brief_title: Therapeutic Options for Treatment of Burning Mouth Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Different Therapeutic Options for Burning Mouth Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: Burning mouth syndrome is a painful condition of unknown etiology that impairs the quality of life and does not have an adequate therapeutic option. The purpose of this study is to determine the most effective treatment option for burning mouth syndrome, among oral probiotics, low-level laser, B-vitamin injections and informative treatment only.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the patient's quality of life using Oral Health Impact Profile 14 questionnaire (OHIP-14)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to two months (follow up was one month after the end of treatment, in each patient)
primary_outcome.description: change in the patient's quality of life determined by self-perceived quality of life questionnaire (Oral Health Impact Profile; OHIP-14)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to two months (follow up was one month after the end of treatment, in each patient)
secondary_outcome.description: change of patient's subjective burning symptoms measured on visual analogue scale (VAS) grading from 0 to 10 (0- without burning, 10- the worst possible burning)

arm_group.description: The patients in this group received only verbal and written information about their condition.

The patients in this group, beside verbal and written information about their condition, received also oral probiotics. They were instructed to melt one lozenge in the mouth in the evening, after tooth brushing and flossing, for one month.
The patients in this group, beside verbal and written information about their condition, received a total of ten low level laser treatments, for ten days consecutively excluding weekends.
The patients in this group, beside verbal and written information about their condition, received a total of nine B vitamin injections, every other day, intra muscular.

intervention.intervention_name: low level laser treatment with Ga-Al-As laser
B vitamin injections (Neurobion, Merck, Darmstadt, Germany)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- newly diagnosed with burning mouth syndrome and excluded local and systemic causes
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who have received treatment for burning mouth earlier
- patients with local or systemic causes of burning mouth
